markdown:
<title level="1" right="Creature Family">[Warg](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=482)</title>

**Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 341 <sup>1.1</sup>

The warg is an intelligent and malevolent wolf that dwells among [goblins](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=55), [hobgoblins](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=61), [orcs](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=80), and violent humanoids.

<title level="2">Members</title>
[Warg](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3230) (Creature 2), [Witchwarg](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3231) (Creature 5)

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Warg Legends</title>

Wargs are the subject of many grim tales and campfire stories. Frightening accounts of wargs gobbling up children whole have a disturbing basis in fact, for these ravenous creatures have jaws that can unhinge like those of a serpent to gulp down small prey while the victim yet lives.
</aside>
name: Warg

Members Warg (Creature 2), Witchwarg (Creature 5) Warg Legends Wargs are the subject of many grim tales and campfire stories. Frightening accounts of wargs gobbling up children whole have a disturbing basis in fact, for these ravenous creatures have jaws that can unhinge like those of a serpent to gulp down small prey while the victim yet lives.
